snippet: After a morning of angry arguments from both sides, Justice Maxwell Wiley said he would not allow lines of questioning intended to prove that parts of a suspect’s confessions in the 1979 killing of Etan Patz were false.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Maxwell Wiley refuses to hear lines of questioning intended to cast doubt on Pedro Hernandez's confession to the 1979 murder of Etan Patz; Hernandez's lawyer had repeatedly attempted to demonstrate basic inconsistencies of fact in his confession.
lead_paragraph: After a morning of angry arguments from both sides, Justice Maxwell Wiley said he would not allow lines of questioning intended to prove that parts of a suspect’s confessions in the 1979 killing of Etan Patz were false.

headline.main: Judge in Patz Case Limits Questions on Confessions
headline.print_headline: At Patz Hearing, Judge Limits Questioning About Confessions
